George H. W. Bush administration, Donald Rumsfeld was at odds with Secretary of State Colin Powell about Iraq. The differences weren't personal, Donald Rumsfeld says. He recalls receiving a book that Henry Kissinger had written, with the inscription, To an occasional adversary and a permanent friend. `` When I started working on the book, Henry Kissinger said,` You tell it like it was.'
